newsitem.title: CHINA: 18.4 pct Rise in Hong Kong air cargo for April.
newsitem.headline: 18.4 pct Rise in Hong Kong air cargo for April.

text.p: April saw an 18.4 percent rise in the total amount of air cargo loaded and unloaded at Hong Kong's Kai Tak airport compared with the same month last year, latest regional statistics from Hong Kong's Civil Aviation Department show.

Traffic to and from Taiwan showed the largest year on year increase with a 37 percent rise followed by a 23 percent increase in cargo to and from mainland China. The only fall to cargo was to and from South America, which traditionally is a weak market, recording a 19 percent fall on total tonnage of just 132 tonnes.
The total amount of air cargo imports from around the world during April was 70,670 tonnes while the total amount of exports reached 77,448 tonnes.
